page.title: 04A NEW SCHOOL IN RHYD Y FRO.
page.content: Last October a new school opened in Rhydyfro. The people of the village had been promised this for a long time.The old village school had grown far too small and the access to it was dangerous. The new school is very different to the other which was built over a hundred years ago. It is a fine building of red brick and sloping roofs of tile. The Nursery is at the back of the school and has its own entrance and play area.Downstairs are the infant and junior classrooms.In each of the three classrooms, which are 50 metres square, there are two teachers. We now have many facilities which we did not have before - a large hall and gymnasium, a kitchen, a withdrawal room, a kiva with rows of steps and a large playing field.
